intro: Henriettea acunae, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and thrives at high altitudes. Henriettea acunae has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
